message.content:
**1) Analysis of the Main Target Image**

There are two separate “builds” in the target image:

• **Tall Tower (left)**  
  – **Bottom Layer:** Three red arch‐blocks side by side.  
  – **Second Layer:** One horizontal green rectangular block resting on top of (and bridging across) the red arches.  
  – **Third Layer:** One red arch‐block centered above the green block.  
  – **Fourth Layer:** Two tall green rectangular “pillar” blocks side by side on top of the red arch.  
  – **Fifth Layer:** One long yellow rectangular block bridging the tops of the two green pillars.  
  – **Top:** One orange triangular “roof” block set on the yellow block.  
  In total, the tower uses 9 blocks.

• **Smaller “House” (right)**  
  – **Bottom Layer:** A 2×2 arrangement of small cubes (two orange and two red).  
  – **Second Layer:** Two green rectangular blocks (oriented front‐to‐back) side by side, forming a green “ring” on top of the 2×2 cubes.  
  – **Top:** One orange triangular roof block.  
  In total, the smaller house uses 7 blocks.

Hence the entire scene has 16 blocks across two structures.

---

**2) Selecting the Required Blocks From the Dictionary**

Below are the dictionary indices that match each needed shape **in the exact orientations shown** (no further rotation allowed):

• **Red arch‐block (arch facing front)**: Index **1**  
• **Orange cube**: Index **5**  
• **Red cube**: Index **6**  
• **Yellow rectangular block (horizontal)**: Index **11**  
• **Green rectangular block (horizontal, left‐to‐right)**: Index **8**  
• **Green rectangular block (vertical “pillar”)**: Index **9**  
• **Green rectangular block (horizontal, front‐to‐back)**: Index **10**  
• **Orange triangular roof (slope front‐to‐back)**: Index **16**

**Quantities Used**  
• **#1 (red arch):** 4 total (3 in the base of the tower + 1 midway up)  
• **#5 (orange cube):** 2 total (bottom layer of the smaller house)  
• **#6 (red cube):** 2 total (bottom layer of the smaller house)  
• **#8 (green rectangular, L–R):** 1 (second layer of the tower)  
• **#9 (green pillar, vertical):** 2 (the two tall columns in the tower)  
• **#10 (green rectangular, F–B):** 2 (the green ring on the small house)  
• **#11 (yellow rectangular, horizontal):** 1 (the tower’s yellow “cap”)  
• **#16 (orange roof wedge):** 2 total (one atop the tower, one atop the house)

---

**3) Assembly Order**

Below is one convenient step‐by‐step sequence. (Note that the same index can appear multiple times.)

{
Step1: Move block with index 1  
Step2: Move block with index 1  
Step3: Move block with index 1  
Step4: Move block with index 8  
Step5: Move block with index 1  
Step6: Move block with index 9  
Step7: Move block with index 9  
Step8: Move block with index 11  
Step9: Move block with index 16  

Step10: Move block with index 5  
Step11: Move block with index 6  
Step12: Move block with index 6  
Step13: Move block with index 5  
Step14: Move block with index 10  
Step15: Move block with index 10  
Step16: Move block with index 16  
}

• Steps 1–9 assemble the tall tower (three red arches on the bottom, green block, red arch, two green pillars, yellow cap, orange wedge).  
• Steps 10–16 assemble the smaller “house” (four cubes in a 2×2 layer, two front‐to‐back green rectangles, then the orange roof).
